intro: Vilfa aspera, commonly known as the rough vilfa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and fern-like, compound leaves that are often covered in fine, rough hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Vilfa aspera is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
